source_sentence: 眾不差輒教授苾芻尼學處第二十一之三爾時諸苾芻見如上事咸復生疑，重白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the monks, seeing these things, again became doubtful and repeatedly said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何意愚路苾芻因少教誡自發正勤，於生死中速能出離，證得究竟安隱涅槃？」
translation: Why is it that a foolish monk who generates his own correct effort because of a little instruction is quickly able to escape from birth-and-death and realize ultimate peaceful nirvāṇa?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝等當知！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "You should know!

source_sentence: 愚路苾芻非但今日因少教誡而能證悟，於過去時，亦因少教自發正勤，得大富貴安樂而住。
translation: Not only can a foolish monk realize enlightenment today because of a little instruction, but in the past, he also aroused correct diligence on his own because of a little instruction, and he became very wealthy and comfortable and stayed there.

source_sentence: 汝等應聽！
translation: All of you should listen!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔於某聚落有一長者，大富多財受用豐足，娶妻未久便生一子，容貌端正廣說如前。
translation: Once upon a time, there was an elder from a certain village who was wealthy and well provided for, and who married a wife and had a son not long before she gave birth to a man of fine appearance who spoke eloquently as before.

source_sentence: 告其婦曰：『賢首！
translation: He told his wife, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 吾今有子費用處多，欲往海中求覓珍寶。』
translation: Now that I have a son, there's much expense, and I want to search for treasures in the ocean.'

source_sentence: 妻言：『隨意。』
translation: His wife said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 長者便念：『我若多留財物與婦人者，此必驕奢恐造非法。』
translation: The man then thought, 'If I leave more property with the woman, I'll be proud and extravagant, and I'm afraid I'll do something wrong.'

source_sentence: 遂便少與。
translation: So he gave them back sparingly.

source_sentence: 於此聚落有一商主，是其知識，持餘財貨皆悉寄之，告云：『今欲經求還期未卜，我婦若於衣食有乏當可給濟。』
translation: There was a merchant in this village who was his friend. He sent all the rest of his goods and told him, 'Now, I don't know when I'll be able to return from my search, but if my wife lacks food and clothing, she'll be able to help her.'

source_sentence: 即持財貨入于大海，遭風破舶往而不歸，被寄之人不為存念。
translation: She then took the goods and put them into the ocean. When the wind broke her ship, she went without returning, but the person to whom she had sent them didn't think about it.

source_sentence: 時長者婦假親族力，及自營為養育其子，年漸長大問其母曰：『我之父祖作何生業得存家道？』
translation: The elderly woman then raised her son with the help of her relatives and her own support, and as he grew older, she asked his mother, 'What did my father and grandfather do for a living that would allow them to preserve the family tradition?'

source_sentence: 母作是念：『我若報云入海興易，或恐此子亦往海中，遭難不還我受孤苦。』
translation: The mother thought, 'If I had reported that I'd gone into the ocean to make things easier, perhaps this son would have gone into the ocean and been plunged into trouble and not returned to me, and I'd have been left alone.'

source_sentence: 遂即報云：『汝之祖父於此興易以為活命。』
translation: She then reported, 'Your grandfather worked here to make fortune in order to save his life.'

source_sentence: 子白母曰：『可與錢財我學興易。』
translation: The son said to his mother, 'I can give you money and property to train in fickleness.'

source_sentence: 母告之曰：『我於何處得有錢財？
translation: His mother told him, 'Where did I get the money and wealth?'

source_sentence: 但假宗親貧力養汝，更無餘物遂汝所求。
translation: But suppose your clan members support you through their poverty, and there's nothing else you can ask for.

source_sentence: 然某甲商主是汝之父故舊知識，可從覓物隨意經營。』
translation: Still, that certain merchant is an old friend of your father's, so you can find things to do as you like.'

source_sentence: 「其子聞已詣商主處，時商主家有人取錢，三返失利，彼正瞋責，求入無因。
translation: "When his son heard this, he went to the merchant's house, where someone had taken money and lost it three times.

source_sentence: 其家婢使持糞掃出，中有死鼠，俱欲棄之。
translation: His maid caused her to sweep out some dung, and there was a dead mouse that they both wanted to throw away.

source_sentence: 長者懷恨告取錢人：『汝今知不？
translation: Holding a grudge, the elder told the person who had taken the money, 'Do you know now?'

source_sentence: 世間有人解求利者，能因此婢所棄之鼠產業豐盈。』
translation: 'Is there anyone in the world who understands the search for profit and can make a fortune from the rat that their maidservant discarded?'

source_sentence: 彼長者子遙聞是說便作斯念：『此大商主終不虛言，豈不由此死鼠能得富樂。』
translation: Hearing this, that elder's son thought, 'After all, this great merchant wasn't lying; couldn't this dead mouse have made him rich and prosperous?'

source_sentence: 即隨婢使觀其住止。
translation: He then followed the servant's messenger to observe where he lived.

source_sentence: 婢以糞鼠棄于坑內，童子取鼠詣大市中，見有飢猫繫頸於柱，以鼠示之。
translation: The maidservant put the rat in a pit, and the boy took the rat and went into the large marketplace where he saw a hungry cat tied to a post and showed it to him.

source_sentence: 彼猫見鼠遂便跳躑，是時猫主告童子曰：『可與死鼠。』
translation: When the cat saw the mouse, it jumped out of the pit. The owner of the cat then told the boy, "You can give it to him as a dead mouse."

source_sentence: 童子報曰：『豈以空言便覓他物？
translation: The boy replied, 'Would you find another thing just because you say nothing?'

source_sentence: 若酬價直我當與鼠。』
translation: If I can pay you well, I'll give it to the mouse.'

source_sentence: 猫主便以一捧豌豆用酬其直。
translation: The cat owner then gave him a handful of peas in return for their straight price.

source_sentence: 是時童子留鼠取豆，便於瓦上熬之令熟，即作是念：『我若盡食，本物全無。』
translation: The boy then left the mouse to get the beans, boiled them on a tile until they were ripe, and then thought, 'If I eat them all, I'll lose everything I had.'

source_sentence: 遂以衣裾裹豆，瓶持冷水，出向村外，於賣樵人停息之處待彼歸還。
translation: Wrapping the beans in the train of his robe and carrying cold water in a jar, he went out to the village and waited at the woodcutter's resting place until he returned.

source_sentence: 時賣樵者日晚俱至，童子見來報言：『大兄！
translation: When the woodcutter arrived late in the afternoon, the boy reported, 'Brother!

source_sentence: 時既炎暑可且停息。』
translation: It's hot and it's scorching hot, so you can stop now.'

source_sentence: 時賣樵人即便暫止，童子遂將熟豆行與諸人，授以冷水。
translation: Even after the woodcutter stopped, the boy handed them some cooked beans and gave them some cold water.

source_sentence: 諸人問曰：『小弟！
translation: They asked, 'Younger brother!

source_sentence: 汝欲何去？』
translation: Where do you want to go?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我欲取樵。』
translation: He answered, 'I want to fetch firewood.'

source_sentence: 報言：『我旦出城今始來至，汝今若去齊暮不還，徒事艱辛必無所獲。』
translation: They replied, 'I left town at sunrise and have just arrived. If you leave now and don't return by sunset, you'll have nothing to gain from all this trouble.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸人各減一樵持以相惠。
translation: Each of those people then took a woodcutter and gave it to them as a gift.

source_sentence: 童子得樵合為一擔，詣市賣之，所得貝齒並買豌豆，悉皆熬熟，瓶持冷水，還之舊處以待樵人。
translation: The boy took the woodcutters and put them together into a load, went to the market to sell it, bought the shells and teeth, bought peas, boiled them all, put them in a jar with cold water, and returned them to their old place to wait for the woodcutters.

source_sentence: 諸人既來同前分布，樵人見喜云：『賴蘇息。』
translation: When the others came to distribute the water as before, the woodcutter rejoiced and said, 'RIP!'

source_sentence: 報言：『汝當日日於此相看，我等人各剩持一樵以酬勞直。』
translation: They replied, 'You must watch over us here day by day, and we'll each carry a woodcutter left over to pay for our trouble.'

source_sentence: 童子緣此遂多獲利。
translation: Because of this, the boy was able to reap many profits.

source_sentence: 是時童子報諸人曰：『兄等持柴勿向市賣，總積我舍，我為賣之計束酬價。』
translation: The boy then reported to the others, 'Brothers, don't sell your firewood in the market; gather it in my cottage, and I'll pay you a bundle for selling it.'

source_sentence: 諸人許可與柴取直。
translation: The men agreed to give the firewood to him and take it straight.

source_sentence: 後於異時遇天陰雨，霖過七日柴價增高，更多得利。
translation: When it rained at another time, the price of firewood increased after seven days of rain, and they reaped even more profit.

source_sentence: 童子自念：『我雖獲利終非久長，賣柴為活人所輕賤。』
translation: The boy thought to himself, 'Even though I may reap a profit, it won't last long; selling firewood is despised by living people.'

source_sentence: 即買諸雜物自為小鋪，獲利轉多。
translation: He then buys various items and makes his own small shop, and the profit he earns increases.

source_sentence: 復作是念：『此之雜物商人所恥。』
translation: Again, he thought, 'This is the sort of thing merchants are ashamed of.'

source_sentence: 便置香鋪依價而賣，倍獲多錢。
translation: He then builds a scent shop and sells it according to the price, and he gets twice as much money.

source_sentence: 復更思惟：『此無大用。』
translation: Again, he thought, 'This is of no great use.'

source_sentence: 便設金鋪得利彌甚、映蔽諸鋪。
translation: He then sets up a gold shop to reap even more profit and cover the shops.

source_sentence: 「商人嫉之，便與施號名鼠金鋪主。
translation: "Being jealous, the merchant then gave his name to the owner of the gold shop, Rat.

source_sentence: 眾共議曰：『諸君當知！
translation: The people agreed, 'You should know this!

source_sentence: 由此鼠金鋪主映奪我等交易不成，我等宜應共至其所，激令入海多求寶物，致令因此死而不歸。』
translation: Since this is how the owner of the rat and gold store imagined taking our goods from us and not being able to make a deal, it would be better for us to go to his place together and provoke him to go into the ocean and search for more treasures, so that he might die and not return.'

source_sentence: 即俱近鋪邊聞語聲處，共為議曰：『君等知不？
translation: They then all went near the shop and heard the sound of voices, and they all agreed, 'Do you know about this?'

source_sentence: 觀諸世間不紹繼人，所為日退。
translation: "When they look at the world and see people who aren't succeeding them, what they do is declining day by day.

source_sentence: 譬如有人先時乘象後便乘馬、棄馬乘輿，復更棄輿步涉而行。
translation: It's like a person who first rides an elephant, then rides a horse, discards the horse, takes a mule, and then discards the mule and wades on foot.

source_sentence: 此鼠金鋪主亦復如是，自祖父已來皆入大海求好珍寶，自濟濟人遠近稱歎。
translation: That mouse, the owner of the gold shop, was likewise. Since his grandfather's time, he's always gone into the ocean to search for good treasures, helping people from near and far to praise him.

source_sentence: 此兒今日不自存立，開小金鋪貝齒交關辛苦求生，誠哉可念！』
translation: Today, this son doesn't survive on his own, but runs a small gold shop where shells and teeth intersect to find a living.

source_sentence: 彼聞此語便問諸人：『君等向來談論何事？』
translation: When they heard this, they asked the others, 'What have you been discussing?'

source_sentence: 諸人具以事答。
translation: The men answered with a detailed explanation of the matter.

source_sentence: 聞是語已默然歸家問其母曰：『我之祖父曾入大海，求覓珍寶為富商主耶？』
translation: After hearing those words, they quietly returned home and asked their mother, 'Did my grandfather go into the ocean to search for treasures and become a wealthy merchant?'

source_sentence: 母作是念：『豈非此子他處聞知，今我不應自作欺誑，宜當依實以事告之。
translation: The mother thought, 'Could it be that this son has been heard elsewhere? Now, I shouldn't deceive myself; I should tell you the truth based on facts.

source_sentence: 汝乃祖乃父皆入海中，為大商主人共稱歎。』
translation: Your grandfather and father both went to the ocean and were praised by the great merchant masters.'

source_sentence: 白母言：『我今亦欲往海洲求覓珍寶。』
translation: He said to his mother, 'Now, I also want to go to a sea island to search for treasures.'

source_sentence: 母曰：『汝不須去。』
translation: Mother said, 'You don't have to go.'

source_sentence: 不久更白，母知意正遂不遮止。
translation: He said again soon afterward, but she knew he had the right intention and didn't stop him.

source_sentence: 見母許已即令遍告城邑：『諸君若有欲入大海求珍寶者，應隨鼠金商主，不輸稅物安隱去還，入海之貨當可預辦。』
translation: After he saw his mother's permission, he ordered her to tell the town, 'Gentlemen, if you want to go to the ocean to search for treasures, you should follow the rattle-gold merchant and return in peace without paying taxes, for the goods that go to the ocean will be ready.'

source_sentence: 時有五百商人，聞告令已各辦海物佇望行期。
translation: When five hundred merchants heard the order, they each prepared their goods for the sea and waited for their departure.

source_sentence: 「時鼠金商主卜問良辰為吉祥事，遂共諸人將諸貨物，車馬擔運往適海濱。
translation: "Divining a good time for an auspicious event, the squirrel-gold merchant owner and his men then sent their goods, carts, horses, and carts to the sea.

source_sentence: 既至海已，諸興易人望海生怖咸有退意，不欲昇舶。
translation: When they arrived at the sea, the people of Nanyang became frightened as they looked out to sea, and they all had second thoughts about ascending to the ship.

source_sentence: 爾時商主恐人盡歸，告拖師曰：『仁可以實報知海中珍貨之物。』
translation: The merchant then, fearing that all the people would return, told the towmaster, 'Sir, you can truly reward us by telling us about the precious goods in the ocean.'

source_sentence: 拖師即便告諸人曰：『汝贍部洲人各應善聽！
translation: Even then, the master told the people, 'You must listen well, you people of Jambudvīpa!'

source_sentence: 此大海中多有奇貨珍玩之物，所謂末尼、真珠、吠琉璃寶、珊瑚、貝玉、金銀、赤珠、右旋妙螺，眾寶非一。
translation: "In this ocean are many exotic and precious things, such as maṇi, real beads, vaiḍūrya jewels, coral, precious jade, gold and silver, red pearls, and a right-hand, wonderful conch, and they're not all one and the same.

source_sentence: 汝等若能入大海中得此寶者，自於一形歡樂受用，父母妻子親族知識，及諸童僕無辛苦者，於時時間悉能給施沙門婆羅門等，當生善趣果報自隨，得往天宮受諸快樂，漸修勝福登涅槃路。
translation: If you enter the ocean and obtain this treasure, you'll enjoy it happily in one form, and your parents, wives, relatives, friends, and servants who don't work hard will all be able to give it to ascetics, priests, and others at that time, who will then be born in a good destiny with its own rewards and go to the heavenly palace to experience various pleasures and gradually cultivate excellent fortune on the road to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 若樂此者宜共昇舶入大海中。』
translation: Those who enjoy this should ascend together and sail into the ocean.'

source_sentence: 然世間人聞得富盛悉皆心喜，即俱昇舶。
translation: Still, when people in the world hear about their prosperity, they're all delighted, and they all ascend to the ships.

source_sentence: 人多舶重，商主便念：『既親勸上，今者如何更令下舶？』
translation: When there were so many people and the ship was so heavy, the merchant thought, 'After having been personally encouraged to ascend, how could I get off the ship now?'

source_sentence: 即告拖師曰：『汝今宜可說大海中過患之事。』
translation: He then told the master of the tug, 'Now, you may speak of the faults and troubles in the ocean.'

source_sentence: 是時拖師聞商主語，即便以實告諸人曰：『贍部洲人汝等當聽！
translation: When the master then heard what the merchant said, he told them the truth, 'Listen, Jambudvīpa!

source_sentence: 此大海中有大怖畏，所謂摩竭大魚吞舟吐浪，洪波迴洑森漫無邊，江豚海狶在處為難，黑風卒起漂泊山隅，裂帆摧幢控告無處。
translation: "There's a great fear in this ocean, which is called the great Maghā fish that swallows boats and spits out waves, floods and turbulence that are limitless, porpoises and sea lions that are in trouble everywhere, a black wind that suddenly arises and wanders across a mountain range, and sails that are torn and banners that are charged with having no place to go.

source_sentence: 復有青旗海賊非意忽來，打破大舶俱斷汝命，遂令汝等棄所愛身，父母宗親不復相見。
translation: Then, a blue-flagged pirate suddenly comes unintentionally, breaks open the great ship and cuts off your lives, causing you to abandon the bodies you love and your parents and relatives to stop seeing each other.

source_sentence: 汝等當自思察不去為善。』
translation: It's good for you to consider for yourselves not to go.'

source_sentence: 時諸人眾多怯少勇，聞斯告已下舶者多，其舶遂便輕重合度，三告令已便拔沈石，長風鼓扇大舶[夌*欠]波，猶如駃雲一翥而去，悉皆安隱得至寶洲。
translation: When the multitude of people, many of whom were timid and few in courage, heard this advice and disembarked from the ship, they then combined their weight with that of the ship, and after three warnings and orders, they then pulled out the sunken rocks, and a long wind whipped up the [undefiled] waves of the great ship like a fleeting cloud, and they all departed in one flight, arriving safely at the precious island.

source_sentence: 拖師告曰：『贍部洲中所有商客皆悉須知，此之寶洲多假琉璃與真寶相似，仁等應可善為試驗方可持之，勿至本鄉方生悔恨。
translation: Master Tārā told them, 'All the merchants on Jambudvīpa should know that this precious continent has many fake beryl stones that resemble real treasures, so you should test them well before accepting them, and don't regret going to your hometown.

source_sentence: 又此寶洲有鳴鶴、羅剎依止而住，若見人時作諸方便，出柔軟語諂誑於人，遂令君等喪失身命。
translation: Also, on this precious island there are cranes and rāṣas that live here, and when they see people, they make tricks, speak softly, and flatter people, which causes you to lose your life.

source_sentence: 又此洲中多是醉果，人若食者於七日中不能醒覺，仁等須知可為警慎。
translation: Also, on this island there's often the fruit of drunkenness, which prevents people from waking up for seven days if they eat it, so you should know to be cautious.

source_sentence: 又此洲處多有非人依止而住，於七日中共相容忍，過七日已便放大風吹破商船。』
translation: Also, there are many people on this island who don't rely on you and tolerate each other for seven days, and then after seven days have passed, they'll blow the merchant ship apart with a big breeze.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人聞是語已各自防固，多收珍寶如稻麻穀豆傾置船中。
translation: After hearing those words, the merchants each took precautions and gathered up many treasures like rice, linen, grain, and beans to put in their boats.

source_sentence: 是時拖師候風便還贍部。
translation: The tow-trader then waited for the wind and returned to Jambū.

source_sentence: 如是七度安隱而歸。
translation: He thus returned seven times in peace.

source_sentence: 「其母告曰：『汝可娶妻安置家業。』
translation: "His mother told him, 'You may take a wife and settle down in the family business.'

source_sentence: 兒白母曰：『我還債後方隨母教。』
translation: The son said to his mother, 'After I repay my debts, I'll follow her instructions.'

source_sentence: 母告子曰：『非汝祖父先有債息，因何今日云還債耶？』
translation: His mother told him, 'Didn't your grandfather have debts and interest in the past, so why are you repaying them today?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我自知有。』
translation: He answered, 'I know I have them.'

source_sentence: 即以四寶造鼠四枚，復以銀槃盛滿金粟，上置四鼠詣父知識商主之家。
translation: He then made four mice out of the four treasures, filled a silver dish with gold corn, and sent the four mice up to his father's house, where he knew the merchant.

source_sentence: 時彼商主共諸人眾論及鼠金：『諸君知不？
translation: The merchant then talked to the people about the gold rats, saying, 'Do you know about this?'

source_sentence: 鼠金商主有大福德，若執瓦石盡成金寶。』
translation: 'The merchant of rat and gold has great merit; if he were to take all the tiles and stones, they would become gold and treasure.'

source_sentence: 作是語時，守門之人告商主曰：『鼠金商主來在門外。』
translation: When he said that, the man guarding the gate told the merchant, 'The rat and gold merchant is here outside the gate.'

source_sentence: 報言：『喚入！
translation: He reported, 'Call him in!'

source_sentence: 無宜見遮。』
translation: It's not appropriate to see the obstruction.'

source_sentence: 門人引入，即以寶鼠金槃前奉商主，白言：『此是本鼠，此是利直。』
translation: The disciple then introduced them, presented the merchant with a golden rat, and said, 'This is the original rat, and this is straightforward profit.'

source_sentence: 商主告曰：『我不曾憶與汝錢財，何故今時云酬本利？』
translation: The merchant told him, 'I don't remember giving you money or property, so why are you now saying that you'll be rewarded with capital and profit?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我為憶之。』
translation: He replied, 'I'll remember it for you.'

source_sentence: 便以往日棄鼠因緣具報商主。
translation: He then reported to the merchant the reasons he'd given up the mouse in the past.

source_sentence: 商主問言：『汝是誰子？』
translation: The merchant asked, 'Whose son are you?'

source_sentence: 答云：『是某長者之子。』
translation: He answered, 'I'm the son of a certain elder.'

source_sentence: 商主曰：『汝即是我知識之子，我宜與汝，豈汝酬還？
translation: The merchant said, 'You are the son of my friend, so I should give it to you.

source_sentence: 汝父去日以多少物置在我處，尚未相還。』
translation: How many things did your father leave with me in the past that have yet to be returned?'

source_sentence: 即以長女許彼為妻，瓔珞嚴身送至其宅。」
translation: He then gave his eldest daughter to be his wife, and he sent her to his house wearing a necklace adorned with jewelry."

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝等苾芻勿生異念，往時商主即我身是，鼠金商主即愚路是。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Don't think differently, you monks, for in the past, the merchant owner was me, and the rat and gold merchant owner was the foolish way.

source_sentence: 我於往日說少因緣，言及死鼠，遂令因此得大富盛。
translation: In the past, I explained a few causes and conditions and talked about a dead mouse, and that led to great prosperity.

source_sentence: 今時因我說少教授，便自策勵斷諸煩惱出生死岸，成勝妙果永證涅槃。」
translation: Now, because I've taught them a little, they'll encourage themselves to end the afflictions and escape the shore of birth-and-death and achieve the wonderful result of permanently realizing nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽愚路於善說法律中出家得果已，王舍城中有大醫王名侍縛迦，聞佛世尊與具壽愚路至愚至鈍而為出家，便作是念：「若佛世尊來至此者，我當請佛及苾芻僧伽，唯除愚路不在請限。」
translation: After Gosshou Fulu had left home and attained the fruit of the well-explained teaching, a great physician king named Svabhūka in Rājagṛha heard that the Bhagavān and Gosshou Fulu had left home because they were so stupid and dull, and he thought, "If the Bhagavān were to come here, I would invite the Buddha and the monks and nuns, except for Fulu Fulu, who would not be invited."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為欲化度諸有情故，從室羅伐漸漸遊行，至王舍城住羯闌鐸迦竹林園中。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, wishing to save all sentient beings, gradually marched from Śrāvastī to the city of Rājagṛha and stayed in the bamboo grove of Kārttika.

source_sentence: 時侍縛迦聞佛來至在竹林園，往詣佛所禮佛足已却坐一面，佛為說法要示教利喜。
translation: When Svabhūka heard that the Buddha had arrived at the bamboo grove, he went to the Buddha, bowed his feet, and withdrew to sit to one side, where the Buddha taught the essentials of the Dharma and showed them how to benefit and rejoice.

source_sentence: 既聞法已從座而起，偏袒右肩右膝著地，合掌恭敬白佛言：「世尊唯願世尊及苾芻僧伽，明日就舍受我微供。」
translation: After hearing the teaching, he got up from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān, please let the Bhagavān and the monks and nuns of the congregation accept my humble offerings tomorrow."

source_sentence: 世尊默然而受，時侍縛迦親覩世尊威德嚴重，不敢對面云除愚路，禮佛而退，往阿難陀所致敬白言：「大德！
translation: The Bhagavān accepted them in silence, and then the attendant Vātsīputrīya, who had seen the Bhagavān's authority and seriousness, didn't dare to face each other and leave the path of folly, saluted the Buddha, withdrew, went to Ānanda, paid homage, and said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我於明日請佛及僧欲設微供，佛德尊重不敢親對云：『除愚路。』」
translation: Tomorrow, I'll ask the Buddha and the saṃgha to make a modest offering, and the Buddha's virtuous and honorable friend won't dare to personally say, 'Remove the path of folly.'"

source_sentence: 時阿難陀報侍縛迦曰：「隨王子心，令福增長。」
translation: Ānanda then rewarded Squire Vātsīputra, "Follow the prince's heart, and you'll increase your fortune."

source_sentence: 時彼王子禮足而去。
translation: The prince then bowed his feet and departed.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀，王子去後往愚路所報言：「具壽！
translation: After the prince left, Ānanda went to the foolish road and reported, "Guisou!

source_sentence: 仁今當知，侍縛迦王子明日請佛及僧就舍受食，唯除具壽一人。」
translation: Now, you should know that the only person Prince Svāhākar will invite the Buddha and the saṃgha to the monastery tomorrow to receive a meal is Gosho."

source_sentence: 是時愚路聞斯語已，報阿難陀曰：「隨王子心，令福增長。」
translation: After hearing this, Fulu reported to Ānanda, "Follow the prince's heart, and you'll increase your fortune."

source_sentence: 時彼王子即於其夜備辦種種上妙飲食，至旦敷設安置水盆，遣使白佛：「今食已辦，唯願知時。」
translation: The prince then prepared a variety of excellent foods that night, spread out the water bowl at sunrise, and sent an envoy to tell the Buddha, "Now that the food has been prepared, may I please know when it's ready."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，於日初分著衣持鉢，大眾隨行唯除愚路詣王子家，到已觀水無蟲、洗足就座而坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl at the beginning of the day, and the whole group followed, except for the foolish path, to the prince's house, where they observed that the water was free of worms, washed their feet, took their seats, and sat down.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀曰：「愚路坐處應可為留。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "The place where Foolish Path was sitting should be reserved."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀奉教留處。
translation: Ānanda then instructed them to stay there.

source_sentence: 是時王子手執金瓶，盛滿清水從上欲行。
translation: The prince then took a golden vial in his hand, filled it with water, and intended to walk up it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊不肯為受，侍縛迦白佛言：「世尊何不受水？」
translation: The Bhagavān then refused to accept it, and the attendant Vātsīputrīya said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān, why don't you accept the water?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「王子！
translation: The Buddha said, "Prince!

source_sentence: 苾芻僧伽猶未普集。」
translation: The bhikṣuṇīs and saṃgha have yet to assemble universally."

source_sentence: 王子白佛：「誰未到來？」
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "Who hasn't arrived yet?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「愚路苾芻尚猶未至。」
translation: The Buddha said, "The foolish monk still hasn't arrived yet."

source_sentence: 王子白佛：「我不請彼。」
translation: The prince said to the Buddha, "I won't invite them."

source_sentence: 佛言：「王子豈汝不以佛為首普請僧眾？」
translation: The Buddha said, "Prince, why don't you take the Buddha as your leader and invite the saṃgha to come?"

source_sentence: 白言：「世尊！
translation: They said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 普請大眾。」
translation: "Invite the whole crowd."

source_sentence: 佛言：「王子！
translation: The Buddha said, "Prince!

source_sentence: 豈彼愚路在眾外耶？」
translation: Is that foolish path outside of the many?"

source_sentence: 王子曰：「不在眾外。」
translation: The prince said, "It's not outside the multitude."

source_sentence: 佛言：「若如是者應可往喚。」
translation: The Buddha said, "If that's the case, you can go and call him."

source_sentence: 侍縛迦便作是念：「我敬佛故令人往喚，不能尊重施其飲食。」
translation: The attendant Vātsīputrīya then thought, "I respect the Buddha and asked him to come and summon you, but I can't respectfully offer him food and drink."

source_sentence: 便命使者曰：「汝今可往竹林中喚具壽愚路。」
translation: He then ordered the messenger, "Now, you may go to the bamboo grove and summon Goswami Yuglu."

source_sentence: 是時愚路於竹林中知王子意，遂化作千二百五十苾芻，皆如愚路形容不殊。
translation: Knowing the prince's intention, Gourryū then transformed into 1,250 monks in the bamboo grove, all of whom were like Gourryū and not different in description.

source_sentence: 使者至寺喚：「具壽愚路，具壽愚路。」
translation: The messengers went to the temple and called, "Gosshou Gululu! Gosshou Gululu!"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻一時咸應，使者不知誰是愚路？
translation: The monks all responded at once, but the messenger didn't know who was Fool's Path.

source_sentence: 便即歸還報王子曰：「於竹林內滿中苾芻，我實不知誰是愚路？」
translation: He then returned to the prince and said, "The bamboo grove is full of monks, but I really don't know who the foolish way is."

source_sentence: 佛告使者曰：「汝往寺中作如是語：『是真愚路當可出來。』」
translation: The Buddha told the messenger, "Go to the temple and say this, 'This is the true path of folly that will lead to escape.'"

source_sentence: 使者尋去到竹林中，喚言：「是真愚路當可出來。」
translation: The messenger went to the bamboo grove and called out, "This is the true Fool's Path that will come forth."

source_sentence: 是時愚路以神通力詣彼留處，就座而坐。
translation: With supernormal powers, Foolish Lu then went to the place where he had stayed and took his seat.

source_sentence: 時侍縛迦見其來已，供佛及僧次第行食，至愚路所不為慇重，雖復授與無信敬心。
translation: When the attendant Vātsīputrīya saw him coming, he offered food to the Buddha and Saṃgha in order, but he didn't take any notice of him until he reached Foolish Path, even though he had been given a faithless veneration.

source_sentence: 世尊便念：「我之弟子德重妙高，此侍縛迦以愚癡故而自傷損，我今宜可彰其勝德。」
translation: The Bhagavān then thought, "My disciple's virtue is so great and marvelous that this Servant Vākṣuṇḍika has harmed himself because of his foolishness; now I can show his excellent qualities."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊飯食訖，時阿難陀欲取佛鉢，世尊不與。
translation: When the Bhagavān finished his meal, Ānanda wanted to take the Buddha's bowl, but the Bhagavān didn't give it to him.

source_sentence: 然世尊常法若未收鉢，諸苾芻眾咸不收鉢。
translation: Still, if the Bhagavān's usual practice is to take the bowl beforehand, the congregation of monks won't take it.

source_sentence: 愚路見諸苾芻飯食訖，不收鉢者有何因緣？
translation: For what reason does a foolish man see that the bhikṣus don't take their bowls when they've finished eating?

source_sentence: 觀知欲彰我德，便移半座長舒其手，如象王鼻，至世尊所而取其鉢。
translation: Observing this desire to demonstrate my virtue, he moved halfway across the throne, extended his hand like the trunk of an elephant king, went to the Bhagavān, and took his bowl.

source_sentence: 是時王子在佛邊立，見其手已，「是何大德現此神通？」
translation: The prince then stood beside the Buddha and saw his hand and asked, "What great man has shown this superknowledge?"

source_sentence: 隨鉢而行欲觀形狀，知是愚路。
translation: As he walked along with his bowl, he wanted to examine his appearance and knew he was on a fool's errand.

source_sentence: 既見是已生大懊惱悶絕躄地，時諸親族以水灑面方乃穌息，便就愚路執足頂禮，求哀懺謝說伽他曰：「栴檀之性恒涼冷，　　嗢鉢羅花體鎮香；　金盤常發妙光明，　　吠琉璃寶常鮮淨。
translation: After seeing this, he became greatly distressed and fell to the ground in a daze. When his relatives sprinkled his face with water, he was able to get some relief, so he bowed his head at his feet to the foolish way, begged for pity, and thanked him, saying, "The nature of sandalwood is always cool, the body of the utpala flower is calm and fragrant, the gold disc always shines with marvelous light, and the vairocana jewel is always pure.

source_sentence: 罪惡之人常恚害，　　猶如畫石卒難除；　聖人常與妙善俱，　　幸願哀憐容恕我！」
translation: An evil person is always malevolent and harmful, like a painted stone that's difficult to remove; a holy person is always accompanied by marvelous goodness; please have mercy on me and forgive me!"

source_sentence: 爾時愚路報王子曰：「我常懷忍，豈有恨心。」
translation: It was then that Fulu responded to the prince, "I've always borne patience, don't I have hatred?"

source_sentence: 是時王子便詣佛所，禮佛足已敬辭而退。
translation: The prince then went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, paid homage, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻至住處已咸皆有疑，請世尊曰：「大德！
translation: When the monks arrived at their dwelling place, they all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 何因緣故侍縛迦王子，未知具壽愚路真實德時即不恭敬，知已禮足求哀懺謝？」
translation: What were the reasons why he didn't venerate Prince Vākṣu when he didn't know the true merit of the life-long, foolish path and begged for pity and thanks after knowing it?"

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「非但今日作如是事，於往昔時亦復如是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Not only do you do this today, but you also did this in the past.

source_sentence: 汝等當聽！
translation: All of you, listen!

source_sentence: 於過去世有一大王名梵摩達多，時北方有販馬商客，驅五百匹馬往詣中國。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a great king named Brahmadatta, and there was a horse trader in the north who drove 500 horses to China.

source_sentence: 時彼商主有一草馬，忽因有娠，是智馬種。
translation: The merchant then had a straw horse that suddenly became pregnant, a breed of wise horses.

source_sentence: 從懷胎日時諸群馬不復嘶鳴，商主便念：『我此群馬為有病耶？
translation: When the horses stopped neighing from the day they were conceived, the merchant thought, 'Are these horses sick?'

source_sentence: 何因多日不復嘶鳴亦不跳躑？』
translation: Why hasn't it been neighing and jumping for days?'

source_sentence: 後時馬生駒已，五百群馬垂耳而住，不敢噴啑作聲。
translation: After the horse gave birth to a colt, five hundred horses hung their ears and didn't dare to make a noise.

source_sentence: 是時商主見斯事已即便生念：『何因有此薄福有情生馬群內，由斯過故令我諸馬皆悉患生？』
translation: After seeing this, the merchant then even had the thought, 'What's the reason this unmeritorious sentient being was born inside the herd of horses, and what's the reason my horses are all afflicted and born because of this mistake?'

source_sentence: 每常乘此草馬，上妙草穀皆不與之。
translation: Every time he rides this straw horse, he doesn't give it the best hay or grain.

source_sentence: 漸次南行至中國境到一聚落，名曰恭侍。
translation: He traveled south gradually to the border of China and came upon a village named Kōshi.

source_sentence: 即於此處時逢夏雨，商主便念：『我若去者馬盡漏蹄，因此患生多有損失，我今宜可於此居停。』
translation: When it rained here in the summer, the merchant thought, 'If I go there, my horse will leak its hooves, and I'll have a lot of trouble and loss, so it's better if I stop here.'

source_sentence: 既停住已，於相近處村邑諸人，隨其工巧各以奇物持奉商主。
translation: After they had stopped, the people of the nearby villages and towns, according to their skill, each gave the merchant something exotic to present to him.

source_sentence: 既至夏了商旅將行，時諸工人悉來送別，商主隨先所得准物相酬。
translation: When the merchants were about to leave at the end of the summer, the workers all came to say goodbye, and the merchant rewarded them with the permitted goods they had previously obtained.

source_sentence: 時有陶師，先以瓦器見奉商主，聞其將去婦告之曰：『君今宜可往別商主，或容憶念以物相酬。』
translation: A potter who had first presented the merchant with a tile container was told by his wife when she heard that he was leaving, 'Now, you might go to bid farewell to the merchant, or perhaps you'll remember to give him something in return.'

source_sentence: 是時陶師聞妻言已，即將泥團作吉祥印，持見商主。
translation: After hearing his wife's words, the potter made a clay ball into an auspicious seal and presented it to the merchant.

source_sentence: 商主見已告言：『男子！
translation: When the merchant saw him, he told him, 'Man!

source_sentence: 汝來太遲，我有貲財並已去訖，欲將何物以表念心？』
translation: You're too late; I have money and property that I've left; what would you like to give me to show my mindfulness?"

source_sentence: 然而商主於小馬駒情無愛惜，謂非吉相，告瓦師曰：『我今唯有此小馬駒，汝若須者隨意將去。』
translation: However, the merchant owner didn't care for the colt and considered it inauspicious. He told the tile master, 'Now, I have only this colt; if you need it, feel free to take it away.'

source_sentence: 瓦師報曰：『我多用功造諸器物，將此駒子蹋之令碎，此無用物於我何須？』
translation: The tile maker replied, 'I've worked hard to make all these things, but I smashed this colt to pieces; why do I need this useless thing?'

source_sentence: 爾時馬駒聞是語已，跪就瓦師舐其雙足，瓦師見已便生愛心，遂即受取牽將至舍。
translation: After hearing these words, the colt knelt down and licked the vaiḍūrya's feet.

source_sentence: 妻見問曰：『往商主處得何財物？』
translation: When his wife saw him, she asked, 'What property did he get from the merchant?'

source_sentence: 夫曰：『得此馬駒。』
translation: The husband said, 'I got this horse and colt.'

source_sentence: 妻曰：『善哉此物！
translation: The wife said, 'Good, this thing!'

source_sentence: 勞我作器隨成蹋損。』
translation: He then made a vessel for me and spoiled it.'

source_sentence: 駒聞此語便至妻所舐其雙足，其妻見已亦起愛心。
translation: When the colt heard this, he went to his wife and licked her feet, and her wife took a liking to him.

source_sentence: 時彼馬駒於諸生熟瓦器之間，行步周旋一無所損，妻報夫曰：『可愛小駒善能用意，行瓦器內竟無傷損。』
translation: The colt then moved around among the ripened tiles without sustaining any damage, and his wife reported to her husband, 'That lovely colt has a good mind for working inside tiles without sustaining any damage.'

source_sentence: 是時瓦師遠去取土，此馬駒子隨後而行。
translation: The tile maker then went away to get some dirt, and this colt followed him.

source_sentence: 時彼瓦師盛土滿帒，小駒便去低背就之，瓦師以帒安脊，徐負其土還來宅中。
translation: When the tile maker filled the trench with dirt, the colt then went and lowered his back to it, and the tile maker placed a tile on the ridge and slowly returned it to the house with the dirt on its back.

source_sentence: 夫告妻曰：『可愛馬駒代我勞苦，我於田中以土帒安脊，汝在舍內可為擎下，常以稻糠和油麻滓用充其食。』
translation: The husband told his wife, 'That lovely colt took over my trouble; I'll put a hoe of earth in the field for the ridge, and you can carry it down inside the house, always feeding it with rice bran and oil and linen.'

source_sentence: 「爾時婆羅痆斯梵摩達多王有一智馬，因疾而終。
translation: "It was then that the Brahmadatta king of Vārāṇasī had a wise horse that died of illness.

source_sentence: 時邊遠國聞王馬死，各遣使報王：『王今宜可輸我國稅，若不與者勿出城門。
translation: When the distant lands heard that the king's horse had died, they each sent an envoy to the king, saying, 'Now, it's advisable for the king to give my country's tax; if you don't give it to them, don't go out of the city gates.

source_sentence: 若更出者繩縛將來。』
translation: If you go further, you'll be bound to the future.'

source_sentence: 王雖聞語不與其物，怖不出城。
translation: Even though the king heard what they said, he didn't give them their goods and was afraid not to leave the city.

source_sentence: 時販馬商人至婆羅痆斯國，王既聞有北方馬至其數極多，告大臣曰：『我頃得勝皆由智馬，今時馬死，乘被欺輕。
translation: When a horse trader arrived in Vārāṇasī, the king heard about the arrival of a great number of horses from the north and told his ministers, 'My past victories were all due to the wisdom of horses.

source_sentence: 我欲幾時城內潛伏，卿等宜應為求智馬。』
translation: I want to lay low in the city for a while, so you should seek out wise horses for them.'

source_sentence: 諸臣受教，共相馬人入馬商旅，觀五百匹馬，知此諸馬被智馬所調，然而遍求不見智馬。
translation: The ministers were instructed, and together with the Soma man they went into the horse caravan and observed 500 horses, knowing that they were trained by the horse of wisdom, but they looked everywhere but didn't see the horse of wisdom.

source_sentence: 時相馬人見其草馬，告牧馬人曰：『君今知不？
translation: When the Soma man saw the draft horses, he told the horseherd, 'Do you know now?'

source_sentence: 此之草馬必產智駒，何意不見？』
translation: This straw horse must have produced a wise foal; why don't you see it?'

source_sentence: 共問商主曰：『君於馬眾曾有出賣或乞人耶？』
translation: They all asked the merchant, 'Have you ever sold or begged for one of your horses?'

source_sentence: 報言：『不曾賣馬，然有一駒將為不吉，於某城邑乞瓦師家。』
translation: He reported, 'I never sold a horse, but there was a colt that was going to be unlucky and asked to be sent to a master's house in a certain town.'

source_sentence: 時相馬人告諸臣曰：『君等當知彼是智馬，商主頑愚不別良駿，棄醍醐上味持無用酥滓。』
translation: The horse inspector then told his ministers, 'You should know that this is a wise horse, a stubborn foolish merchant who doesn't distinguish good horses and discards the excellent taste of ghee to hold useless dregs.'

source_sentence: 俱白王已，往恭侍城到瓦師所而問曰：『君今何用此馬駒耶？』
translation: After they all told the king, they went to Kōshi and asked the warrior at his home, 'Why are you using this horse and colt?'

source_sentence: 報言：『我令負土。』
translation: He replied, 'I'll make you carry the load.'

source_sentence: 相馬人曰：『我與汝驢共相博換。』
translation: The horse-follower said, 'I'll trade with your donkey.'

source_sentence: 報言：『不可。』
translation: He replied, 'No.'

source_sentence: 大臣報曰：『四牛兼車肯相換不？』
translation: The minister reported, 'Will you exchange the four oxen and the chariot?'

source_sentence: 報言：『我愛此駒車牛無用。』
translation: They replied, 'I love this horse, chariot, and ox, and it's useless.'

source_sentence: 諸臣曰：『汝可審思，明當重來。』
translation: The ministers said, 'You may consider it; you'll come back tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 即便辭去。
translation: They quickly left.

source_sentence: 馬駒雖居畜類智識過人，相時而動便為人語，諸臣去後馬駒告瓦師曰：『向者人來欲何所覓？』
translation: Although the colt lives like an animal, its intelligence is superior to that of humans, and when it moves in response to a signal, it speaks for humans. After the ministers left, the colt told the monk, 'What do you want from a person who's come before?'

source_sentence: 報言：『覓汝。』
translation: He replied, 'Seeking you.'

source_sentence: 『若相求者何不與之？
translation: 'If you're looking for someone, why don't you give them to him?'

source_sentence: 仁今不應作如是念，令我終身為君負土，稻糠麻滓而充食耶？
translation: Shouldn't you now think, 'Sir, that I should carry your load of dirt for the rest of my life, feeding myself on chaff and ashes?'

source_sentence: 若有剎利大王受灌頂位，百枝金蓋擎以覆身，如是勝人我當持負。
translation: "If there's a great king of the bhadra who's been consecrated and has a hundred gold lids placed over his body, I will carry the burden of such a victorious man.

source_sentence: 若我食時，於金盆內蜜和糠米隨意食之。
translation: When I eat, I'll mix honey with chaff and rice in a golden bowl and eat it as I like.

source_sentence: 若彼諸人明日來至問馬駒者，仁應報曰：「君等何故相輕？
translation: If those people come tomorrow and ask about the colt, you'll be rewarded, "Why do you despise them?

source_sentence: 若稱智馬詐為不識，喚作馬駒。
translation: "Suppose he calls a wise horse, deceiving him as unaware and calling him a colt.

source_sentence: 若論價者索一億金，或可以金盛之於帒，以我右足盡力牽來。
translation: If someone asks for 100 million pieces of gold, maybe they can put it in a holder and pull it with their right foot.

source_sentence: 若得此者當以相與。」』
translation: If I get this, I'll give it to him."

translation: The ministers came tomorrow and asked the Vasiṣṭha master, 'Men!

source_sentence: 汝思量未？』
translation: Have you thought about it?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我已思決。』
translation: He replied, 'I've already made up my mind.'

source_sentence: 曰：『與馬駒不？』
translation: He said, 'Is it like a horse and stallion?'

source_sentence: 瓦師即以智馬所言悉皆具答。
translation: The vajra master then answered everything the wise horse had said.

source_sentence: 時相馬人聞是語已，自相謂曰：『此之瓦師頑愚寡識，寧知此馬智非智耶？
translation: After the horse-followers heard this, they said to each other, 'How could this master know whether this horse is wise or not, given his stubbornness and lack of knowledge?'

source_sentence: 蓋應是馬思欲報恩，於昨夜中教其作計。』
translation: It was probably because Mars wanted to repay a kindness that he taught him to contrive last night.'

source_sentence: 大臣告曰：『瓦師！
translation: The minister told him, 'Washi!

source_sentence: 隨智非智可論價直。』
translation: 'According to wisdom and non-wisdom, we can discuss price and directness.'

source_sentence: 瓦師曰：『與真金一億當可隨意，或復滿袋盛金，令馬右足牽得為量。』
translation: The monk Vasiṣṭha said, 'It's possible to give 100 million pieces of real gold as you like, or perhaps fill a sack with gold and have a horse pull it by its right foot to get a measure.'

source_sentence: 諸臣議曰：『此有大力一倍牽金，宜酬一億斯為揩定。』
translation: The ministers agreed, 'This is a powerful man who can pull twice as much gold as he wants, so it would be appropriate to pay him 100 million to get it off.'

source_sentence: 諸臣遣使往白大王：『今獲智馬，索金一億。』
translation: The ministers sent a messenger to the king, saying, 'Now that we've got the horse of wisdom, we're asking for 100 million pieces of gold.'

source_sentence: 王得信已告使者曰：『隨索多少與價將來。』
translation: When the king received the message, he told the messengers, 'Give him whatever amount he asks for.'

source_sentence: 便持億金令使取馬。
translation: He then took the hundred million pieces of gold and told the messenger to fetch the horse.

source_sentence: 其使到彼既與金已，便將智馬至婆羅痆斯，牽入馬厩安第一槽，便以穬麥并草餧之。
translation: After the messenger gave him the gold, he took the horse of wisdom to Vārāṇasī, took it into the stable, put it in the first trough, and fed it with young wheat and grass.

source_sentence: 馬不肯食，王自親觀見其不食，報掌馬人曰：『豈此智馬先有病耶？』
translation: The horse refused to eat, and when the king himself saw that it wasn't eating, he told the horse handler, 'Did this horse of wisdom have a disease?'

source_sentence: 白言：『大王！
translation: Baiyan: 'Great king!

source_sentence: 馬實無病，我今應問。』
translation: 'The horse really isn't sick, so now I should ask.'

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「『汝豈不憶陶師舍，　　穀麥水草常闕乏；　　身體羸瘦唯皮骨，　　飢虛自食野田苗。
translation: Sugata said, "Don't you remember the potter's cottage, where grain, wheat, and water and grass are always scarce?

source_sentence: 日夜恒隨瓦師意，　　身常負土遭困辱；　　今為國王乘御首，　　何因不食似懷憂？』
translation: Day and night, I'm always following the Vasiṣṭha's wishes, and I'm always burdened with the hardships of the land. Now, I'm the king's royal leader, so why doesn't it seem like I'm worried when I don't eat?'

source_sentence: 「爾時智馬心懷不忍，怒而報曰：「『我有迅足心驍勇，　　詳審智策眾無過；　　所有勝德汝皆知，　　何故令人共輕慢？
translation: "At that point, the Zhima's mind became intolerant, and he angrily retaliated, saying, 'I have swift legs and a strong heart, and I've done nothing wrong to scrutinize the wisdom of many people; you all know their excellent qualities, so why do people despise them?'

source_sentence: 唯汝能知於善惡，　　不依古法相遵奉；　　我今閉口寧當死，　　不被他輕而得生。
translation: 'Only you can know good from evil and not follow the ancient teachings; now I'd rather die than be despised by others and be born.

source_sentence: 縱被愚人久欺慢，　　我分不生憂惱心；　　見知己者暫生輕，　　令我懷愁不望活。』
translation: Even if I've been deceived by foolish people for a long time, I won't become sad and troubled; seeing someone who knows themselves being born for a short time makes me sad and not expect to live.'

source_sentence: 「時掌馬人聞此說已白大王曰：『王今宜可於智馬處，隨古仙法所為次第而供給之；若非次第必不肯食。』
translation: "When the horse handler heard this, he said to the king, 'Now, the king would like to offer the wise horses in the order in which the ancient sage teachings were presented to him; otherwise, he would surely refuse to eat.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『如何次第？』
translation: The king said, 'In what order?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『應可去城有三驛許，平治道路幡蓋莊嚴，王從四兵當自迎接，所安置處以赤銅鍱而砌其地，東宮太子自擎千枝金蓋而覆其上，王之長女執金寶莊拂為去蚊蠅，國大夫人蜜塗穬米盛以金盤，自手擎持用充其食，第一大臣親執金箕以承其糞。』
translation: He answered, 'There are three or so journeys from the city, a road that's paved and decorated with banners and shrouds, a place where the king's four soldiers will meet him, a place where he's placed that's covered with a metal sheet of red brass, a thousand gold lids carried by the prince of the eastern palace, a golden jeweled duster held by the king's eldest daughter to keep away insects and flies, a golden dish filled with rice coated with honey and used by the king's eldest wife to carry her own food, and a golden duster carried by the first minister himself to carry his dung.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『如斯供給，此即是王，我復何用？』
translation: The king said, 'Such are the offerings to the king, so what use would I be?'

source_sentence: 掌馬人曰：『此非常爾，但齋七日，延迎法式理必須然。』
translation: The horse handler said, 'This is not the case; it's only a seven-day fast, and the rules for prolonging the welcome must be followed.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『已過之事不可重為，餘現前者應如法作。』
translation: The king said, 'What's been done before mustn't be done again; the rest of what's being done now should be done according to the rules.'

source_sentence: 即於厩中馬住之處布赤銅鍱，太子自持千枝金蓋而覆其上，王之長女執拂袪蠅，國大夫人金盤授食，大臣執箕為其承糞。
translation: He spread a red copper sheet in the stable where the horse was staying, and the prince covered it with a thousand gold lids, while the king's eldest daughter carried a whisk to remove flies, the king's eldest wife gave food from a gold dish, and the minister carried a skip to carry his dung.

source_sentence: 馬見如是微妙供給即便噉食。
translation: Seeing such a marvelous offering, the horse even devoured it.

source_sentence: 時掌厩人說伽他曰：「『大王今與汝，　　上妙供給事；　　所須皆稱意，　　於王當盡心。』
translation: The stable manager then said to him, "Now, the king has given you this wonderful offering; please agree to everything that's necessary, and you will fulfill your heart's desire to the king."

source_sentence: 「馬答彼人曰：『我隨君言，所應作者心無怠慢。』
translation: "The horse answered that man, 'I'll do as you say, and I won't be lazy in mind when I do what I'm told.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王欲詣苑園，臣以種種殊妙寶物而為鞍轡，莊嚴智馬至大王所。
translation: It was then that the king wanted to go to the garden, and his ministers saddled a wise horse with a variety of marvelous treasures and adorned it with a bridle.

source_sentence: 是時智馬見王將御，馬便偃脊。
translation: When the horse of wisdom saw the king about to ride, it lay down its back.

source_sentence: 王曰：『馬患背耶？』
translation: The king said, 'Does the horse have a problem with its back?'

source_sentence: 御者答曰：『此不患背，恐王難昇所以偃脊。』
translation: The ruler answered, 'This doesn't bother my back, but I'm afraid it would be difficult for the king to ascend, so he'll lay down his back.'

source_sentence: 王便御馬行至河邊，馬不肯進。
translation: The king then took his horse to the river, but the horse refused to enter.

source_sentence: 王問御者曰：『馬有怖心，不肯入水？』
translation: The king asked the royal servant, 'Does the horse have a fearful heart and won't enter the water?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此非怖水，恐有霑濕灑著王身，為斯不入。』
translation: He answered, 'This isn't frightening water; I'm afraid some moisture will get on the king's body and prevent it from entering.'

source_sentence: 即結其尾盛以金囊，涉水而過。
translation: He then tied his tail and put a gold bag in it, wading through the water.

source_sentence: 王至苑內縱逸而住，遂經多日，四遠諸國聞王住居苑內，多興兵眾來投城門。
translation: When the king arrived at the park and stayed there uninhabited, many countries from four distant lands heard that the king was staying at the park and raised armies to throw themselves against the city gates.

source_sentence: 王聞邊國兵眾俱至，便乘智馬欲取後門而入城內，於其中路有一大池名曰妙梵，多諸蓮華嗢鉢羅等彌覆其上。
translation: When the king heard that the troops from the other kingdoms had arrived, he rode his horse of wisdom to take the back entrance and enter the city. In the middle of the road there was a large pond called Myōvana, covered with lotus flowers and pauldrons.

source_sentence: 是時智馬既至池邊，足蹈蓮花徐行而過，得入城中，邊賊逃散。
translation: When the horse of wisdom reached the edge of the pond, he stepped on the lotus blossoms and walked across, gaining entry into the city, and the border bandits fled.

source_sentence: 時王大喜告諸臣曰：『卿等知不？
translation: The king was delighted and told his ministers, 'Do you know about this?'

source_sentence: 若有能於灌頂剎利大王救其命者，彼欲如何以酬恩德？』
translation: If someone were able to save his life at the consecration of King Śāriputra, how would they like to repay that merit?'

source_sentence: 諸臣白言：『合與半國。』
translation: The ministers said, 'Let's give them half the country.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『彼是畜生，如何與其半國之賞？
translation: The king said, 'That's an animal, how can we give it half the country's reward?'

source_sentence: 宜應為彼於七日中廣設無遮，與作非時俱物頭會，隨所須者皆悉給之。』
translation: It would be appropriate to set up for them a seven-day, no-holds-barred meeting of monks and nuns who make things happen at non-regulation times, and give them whatever they need.'

source_sentence: 諸臣奉教悉皆為作。
translation: The ministers followed their instructions and all did so.

source_sentence: 「時販馬商主見設大會，問諸人曰：『何故非時作此大會？』
translation: "When the horse trader who had set up the assembly saw it, he asked the men, 'Why is this assembly being held at an ungodly hour?'

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：『君豈不憶於恭侍城以一馬駒乞瓦師耶？
translation: The men replied, 'Doesn't it occur to you that you used a horse and colt to beg for a warden at Kōshijo?'

source_sentence: 彼是智馬舉世稱珍，王以一億金就彼市得，能活王命。
translation: That horse of wisdom is prized throughout the world, and the king buys it on the market for 100 million pieces of gold, and it's able to give life to the king.

source_sentence: 緣斯喜慶故設無遮。』
translation: It's because of this joy and happiness that he has set up Mokṣa.'

source_sentence: 商主聞已便作是念：『豈我留駒是其智馬？
translation: After hearing this, the merchant then thought, 'Could it be that my stallion is that horse of wisdom?'

source_sentence: 我今宜往觀彼形容。』
translation: Now, I should go and see their descriptions.'

source_sentence: 既至廐所，智馬見已問言：『商主！
translation: When he arrived at the stable, the horse of wisdom saw him and asked, 'Master merchant!

source_sentence: 所賣眾馬獲得幾何？
translation: How many horses were sold, and how many did they obtain?

source_sentence: 我獨一身以一億金報瓦師訖。』
translation: I alone will repay the master of the tiles with 100 million pieces of gold," he said.

source_sentence: 商主聞已悶絕躄地，水灑方穌，便捧馬足申謝而去。」
translation: After hearing this, the merchant was dazed and crippled to the ground, and when the water sprinkled Fonsuke, he took the horse's feet, thanked him, and departed."

source_sentence: 爾時佛告諸苾芻：「汝等勿生異念！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the monks, "Don't think differently!

source_sentence: 往時商主者即侍縛迦太子是，往時智馬者即愚路苾芻是。
translation: "In the past, the merchant owner was Prince Svabhūka, and in the past, the wise horse was the foolish monk.

source_sentence: 往昔商主未識智馬有勝德時便生輕蔑，知勝德已懺謝而去。
translation: In the past, when the merchant owner didn't know that the wise horse had superior qualities, he became contemptuous, and after he knew they were superior, he thanked him and left.

source_sentence: 今時侍縛迦未知愚路有勝德時便生慢心，及知具德禮足申謝。
translation: Now, when he didn't know that Fool's Path had superior qualities, Svāhākar became proud and knew that it had them, saluted his feet, and thanked him.

source_sentence: 是故諸苾芻！
translation: "Therefore, monks!

source_sentence: 凡夫之人自無慧目，不應於他輒生輕慢，當以智慧隨處觀察，如是應學。」
translation: Ordinary people lack the eye of wisdom for themselves, so they shouldn't easily become dismissive of others; they should observe them everywhere with wisdom and train accordingly."

source_sentence: 教授苾芻尼至日暮學處第二十二
translation: Teaching Bhikṣuṇīs to the 22nd place of training at sunset

source_sentence: 佛在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園。
translation: The Buddha was at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 佛令難鐸迦教授苾芻尼應為說法。
translation: The Buddha instructed Nandaka to teach the nuns who should preach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時蓮花色苾芻尼與五百徒眾，來詣具壽難鐸迦所，俱禮足已在一面坐，求請教授宣揚妙法。
translation: The lotus-colored monk and his five hundred disciples then went to Kauśāmbī Nandaka, paid homage to their feet, sat down at one side, and asked him to teach and preach the wonderful Dharma.

source_sentence: 時難鐸迦即以圓滿句義，美妙言辭為其說法，聽者忘疲遂至日暮。
translation: Nandaka then taught them the perfect teaching and beautiful words, and the listeners forgot about it until sundown.

source_sentence: 諸尼方去即至門所，城門已閉。
translation: After the nuns had left, they went to the gate, which was closed.

source_sentence: 時諸尼眾喚為開門，守門者曰：「門已關訖。」
translation: The nuns then called out to them to open the gate, but the gatekeeper said, "The gate is closed."

source_sentence: 尼復告曰：「汝父敬信，何因遮我？
translation: The nun again told them, "Your father respected and trusted you, why did you shut me out?

source_sentence: 當為我開。」
translation: It will be opened for me."

source_sentence: 報云：「門鑰已付王家，無由能得。」
translation: They replied, "The key to the gate has been given to the king's family, and there's no way to get it."

source_sentence: 時諸尼眾既不得入，遂相告曰：「去斯不遠有空園林，可共投宿。」
translation: Since they couldn't enter, the nuns told each other, "There's an empty grove not far from here, so we can sleep together."

source_sentence: 如世尊說：「雖居樹下亦依次共分。」
translation: As the Bhagavān said, "Even though they live under a tree, they'll share it in order."

source_sentence: 彼便依次而分與之：此是聖者某甲樹，此是某甲地，便作諠聲令外聞徹。
translation: They then shared with him in order, saying, 'This is the noble one's certain tree, and this is the certain ground,' and then made a loud noise so that outsiders would hear it.

source_sentence: 時有五百盜賊，欲至城傍而為偷竊，聞彼尼聲便相告曰：「未可近城，且當劫此諸老宮人。」
translation: When they heard the nuns' voices, they told them, "You can't go near the city; you'll rob the old palace people here."

source_sentence: 時蓮華色尼觀知賊至，便作是念：「勿令群賊劫同梵行現可惡相，我當觀察，勿使由此諠聲生他不信。」
translation: Observing the thieves' arrival, the Padmasaṃbhava nun then thought, "Don't let these thieves rob the same religious practitioners and show a despicable sign; I will observe them, so that this noisy noise won't lead to disbelief."

source_sentence: 觀見五百群賊欲來竊盜，遂化作毘盧宅家軍兵鼓聲四合。
translation: Observing the crowd of 500 thieves who wanted to steal, she transformed into an army of soldiers from the Vairocana school with drums blaring in all directions.

source_sentence: 賊相告曰：「此是王軍四面圍合，必當殺我命在須臾。
translation: The thieves told each other, "The king's army is surrounded on all sides by this, and it will surely kill us in a moment's time.

source_sentence: 我等宜應四竄逃走。」
translation: We should all flee in four directions."

source_sentence: 賊既散已，時蓮花色尼告諸尼曰：「姊妹！
translation: After the pirates scattered, the lotus-colored nuns then told the nuns, "Sisters!

source_sentence: 有五百群賊夜聞語聲欲來相劫，我以神力令其逃竄。
translation: Five hundred bandits hear the sound of voices at night and want to rob them, but I cause them to flee with my supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 汝等宜應小聲分布。」
translation: It's better for you to keep your voices low and spread out."

source_sentence: 即於此宿旦乃入城。
translation: It was then that they entered the city at sunrise on the night before.
